instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: Water Damaged Macbook is turning on but no keyboard or trackpad. I started measuring the pins on the keyboard on pin 30 i have 3.3v that's <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> and pin 4 and 5 i have 3.29v, however on the rest of the pins i get variable voltage goes from 2.9v to 1.7 and up and down up and down. Any ideas ? Also im missing <SIGNAL>PP18V5_S5</SIGNAL> on the trackpad connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: Have you tried a known good trackpad and keyboard ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: Yes i already tried good known trackpad and keyboard

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: I have 3.3v on pin 49 and pin 22 on <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, also i have 3.29V on pin 4 and i have 3.29V pin 51(<SIGNAL>SMC_PME_S4_WAKE_L</SIGNAL>). What other missing signals would make this chip not functioning ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: See if it does do a PRAM reset. Was this liquid damaged?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: i can't do pram reset but if i press the option then gives me an option to choose the boot device and if i try to connect to wifi i can actually type. So the keyboard working when i have the boot options. ANy ideas

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: And yes the board was water damaged

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: Test all pins of trackpad connector to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, could be corroded trace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: i checked all for continuity they are all good

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: Check 18V to trackpad, must be plugged in for it to be present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: I have 18v when the trackpad is plugged

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: There is not much more to this. Was there corrosion around trackpad/KBD connector?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No trackpad no Keyboard
threads.message: I washed the board again and is working now. Thank you Duke
